title: Language Education Course Design for Enhancing Communication Skills Using Activity-Based Training (ABT)

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level language proficiency (oral/written communication, grammar comprehension, basic vocabulary usage) and experience using basic learning tools (digital collaboration platforms, LMS)
context.additional_context: Hybrid education model applying IIW welding workforce training guidelines to language learning, integrating smartphone-based visual collaboration tools (real-time translation, voice recording, text sharing). Enhanced multimedia content to improve learners' reading comprehension, expressive abilities, and cultural context understanding.

learning_goals: Learners improve oral and written communication skills (pronunciation, vocabulary, grammar, discourse structure) by 30% through ABT activities based on real-world language scenarios (conversations, presentations, negotiations).

Learners use LMS (e.g., Moodle, Blackboard) and e-learning content (videos, quizzes, text analysis tools) to select ≥3 weekly learning modules over 4 weeks, establish weekly plans (time allocation, goals, evaluation criteria), achieve ≥80% implementation, and submit weekly learning journals (200+ characters, <5% grammatical errors) on the LMS.

Learners complete a 4-phase (planning-research-analysis-presentation) collaboration task with three team members using digital whiteboards (Miro, Jamboard) and video tools (Zoom, Microsoft Teams), achieving ‘excellent’ ratings in ≥4 of 5 peer evaluation rubric criteria (participation, creativity, language accuracy, teamwork, deliverable quality).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
